_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Farmers Cooperative Association
P.O. Box 308
Snyder, OK 73566

For futher information contact the General Manager

Risk Management Plan-Executive Summary


1.  The Facility Policy:  The owners, management, and employees of the Farmers Cooperative Asssociation, Snyder Oklahoma are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire company or other authorities to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.

2.  Facility Information:  Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored, and distributed for the direct application and for crop production nutrients.  The maximum quantity stored would be 210,000 pounds in our two storage tanks (1-30,000 gal. & 1-18,000 gal).

3.  The accidental release program:  The facility has implemented the provisiions of "Safey Requirements for the Storage & Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, Kk-611.1", published by The American National Standards Instute, Inc., and the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and handling of Anhydrous Ammonia".

4.  The Five-year Accidental History:  
     a.  There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that:
          i.  Have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facililty; nor to our knowledge have resulted    
              in any offsite deaths, injuries, evacuatioins, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.

5.  The Emergency Response Program:

     The facility has:

     a.  A written Emergency Action Plan, in accordance with OSHA standards, 29 CFR 1910.38;

     b.  Provided state and local authorities the emergency planning and community right-to-know information as required 
          under SARA Title III (EPCRA)
     
6.  Planned Changes to Improve Safety:  Safety improvement is an on-going pro

cess at the facility.  Perodic evaluations are 
     performed to assess the maintenance of of safe conditions. There are no additional specific anhydrous ammonia safety
     recommendations for implementation at this time.
